result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Paul Romportl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the debt is not paid or payment arrangements have not been met, the Clerk of Courts office will refer the amount due to the WDOR for collection action.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Paul Romportl

records.addlTxt: 02:01 PM Defendant Robert Paul Romportl in court.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Schieffer: guilty/no contest to charge w/court costs ($443) and restitution $70 plus 10% surcharge. Defendant agrees. Court goes over Defendant's right to attorney; Def waives his right to attorney.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant pleas guilty to charge.   Court finds Defendant is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily and waives his right to an attorney and his constitutional rights. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea. Court finds Defendant guilty of charge. ADA Schieffer addresses sentencing-  Victim's rights are in compliance. Defendant addresses the court. Court orders court costs ($443) due in 3 months, restitution of $70.00 plus 10% surcharge and DNA sample within 30 days.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 2:12
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant must report to the Pierce County Day Report Center today for fingerprints and photograph.
NO CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH D.N.B. OR HER RESIDENCE.

10:18 AM Defendant Robert Paul Romportl appears in Court, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. NG. DA Hatch is requesting a $ SIBS w/condition of , no objection. Court so orders. Court adjourned at 10:20 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
